data.title: Add ability to use custom script templates.
data.body:
Templates will be loaded from .godot/script_templates
For now they're disabled for GDNative.

![templates](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8281916/27102260-1baf2c9c-5074-11e7-87ae-ba48ce221efe.png)

Ideas for further improvements:

- Supply a bunch of default templates.
- Add a "Save as Template" option to the script editor, as it can normally only save to res://
- Support more placeholders / custom placeholders

Fixes #4132

data.title: Don't append standard ports to the request header.
data.body:
Breaks the SSL communication with some servers,
follow the curl, wget, firefox & co

Fixes #9146

data.title: [3.0] Image get_rect
data.body:
get_rect returns incomplete sub image when the rect.position is > (0, 0)
![test](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4741886/27092723-8dece64c-5064-11e7-84d8-5126bda11963.png)

It should look like this

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4741886/27092746-a8b3976e-5064-11e7-9958-dd4cba3d2979.png)

Part of Spritesheet

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4741886/27093078-b14c674c-5065-11e7-8013-76eeb0109ab6.png)


```
func _ready():

	var it = ImageTexture.new()
	it.load("res://spritesheet.png")
	
	#save sub image
	var rect = Rect2(10, 0, 32, 32)
	var sub_image = it.get_data().get_rect(rect)
	sub_image.save_png("res://test.png")
```

OS: windows
master branch

data.body: Binds method: Engine.is_in_fixed_frame(), more info in #3698

data.title: Virtual Scipting: Nodes change size randomly when selected
data.body:
Arch Linux, Godot 3.0 master

VS scripting nodes often randomly expand when being moved or selected. Example:

![vscript](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7927471/27090789-7bd892ea-505e-11e7-8de2-ab6d05687c35.gif)

data.title: Open Script on Line number with EditorPlugin
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1.3 Steam Stable

Using [EditorPlugin](https://godot.readthedocs.io/en/stable/classes/class_editorplugin.html); 
May I suggest we add the option to open a script on a specific line?

This would be useful in the case of [Jahn's TODO plugin](https://github.com/need12648430/godot-todo)  - Instead of just opening the script, we could open it and navigate to a specific line number. :)

data.title: added signal "button_pressed" to ButtonArray base class
data.body:
ButtonArray has a "button_selected" signal, but not a "button_pressed" signal, which makes code in gdscript more complex to handle situations when you want to get the button that the user really clicked, instead of just "selected". The buttons that inherit from BaseButton all have the "pressed" signal, which made this puzzling for me. So, here is said fix.

I will also attach an example project with everything setted to test this new signal with(as of now) the current master branch.
[bArrayButton_signal_pressed.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1071425/bArrayButton_signal_pressed.zip)

data.title: [3.0] Failed to get path from RPC
data.body:
I'm working on network support and keep running into the error message: **"Failed to get path from RPC"**

**Test godot project avilable here:**
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B_nQZvJoqbFmUmlHSVJ5OE9FSWc

**To reproduce:**
Run project on machine A and click "Host Server"
Run project on machine B and enter IP and click "Join"

Once a message pops up indicating the client has joined...
On machine A press "Do Things 3"
Machine B will get an error message **"Failed to get path from RPC"**.

**Notes:**
I am making this occur by faking lag in my test project, but in my game I do not have the fake lag and get the problem.

The problem is that the object has not yet been created on the client before the client receives rpc calls that operate on that object.

data.title: Allow change of constant Gravity (9.81)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1.3 Steam Stable

It came to my attention that get_weight() is using a constant 9.81 to calculate weight. I would suggest that we allow users to change the gravity constant from within the Project Settings -> Physics 2D (I assume this is also needed in 3D).

**Hardcoded 9.81:**
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/scene/2d/physics_body_2d.cpp#L591

data.title: typing ">" or "<" cycles active scripts in editor
data.body:
Arch Linux, Godot 3.0 master, German keyboard layout(qwertz)

If there are multiple scripts (or help windows) opened, whenever I type ">" or "<" the script editor changes to the next or previous script after typing the actual character, which is really annoying. This is probably due to conflicting keybindings, but I haven't changed any of the default bindings myself.

Cycling through scripts with a shortcut seems to be intended. However, "<" and ">" are not a good choice, because they are often used while coding.

steps to reproduce:
1. open a script
2. open another script
3. try to type ">" or "<" in any of them

data.title: Area2D overlaps_area() bug with monitorable property
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.2 though i think the problem should be there for godot 2.1 too.

**Issue description:**
let's say we have two area2Ds named 1 and 2 and 2 is overlapping with 1.
while 2 is overlapping with 1, set the monitorable property of 1 to false and take 2 to a position that won't overlap with 1 if the monitorable property was set to true and set the monitorable property of 1 to true again.
now if you call the function overlaps_area for 2 for checking if it overlaps with 1 even though it isn't overlapping with 1, it returns true.

data.title: _draw_polygon does not work with colors array (only single color works)
data.body: This is how the stylboxes are drawn now. https://youtu.be/1UTMRCvx6Mg They are effected by the color I choose in the inspector. My draw poly command is structured like this: arrayOfVerts ArrayOfColors ArrayOfIndices the arrayOfColors and the ArrayOfVerts are the same length because that's how the _draw_poly function I used was implemented, one color for one vert (not per index). Is that the issue. Why it the color chooses in the Insoctor affecting it? And a screenshot for the lazy ones who won't checkout the youtube video:

data.title: HTTPRequest doesn't work with some https servers.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** linux 4.8, godot 2.1.3, godot tip **Issue description:** I made a simple test page, that demonstrates the effect: https://www.capitanio.org/tests/godot/ A curl, wget, firefox, chromium, â€¦ doesn't have any problem, so I think it's a godot issue. The URL https://www.capitanio.org/tests/godot/ok.html (apache server) works fine, but the providers apache+php7 server for some reason doesn't recognizes the godot's (ssl) request: ``` extends HTTPRequest request("https://www.capitanio.org/tests/godot/") ``` gives a response: ``` CERT STR: /CN=www.capitanio.org VALID: 1 CONNECTION RESULT: 1 cert_ok: 1 result: 0 response_code: 400 headers: [Date: Tue, 13 Jun 2017 06:42:29 GMT, Server: Apache/2.4.25 (Unix), Content-Length: 362, Content-Type: text/html; charset=iso-8859-1, Vary: Accept-Encoding, Connection: close] body.length: 362 body: 400 Bad Request

Bad Request

Your browser sent a request that this server could not understand.
Reason: You're speaking plain HTTP to an SSL-enabled server port.
Instead use the HTTPS scheme to access this URL, please.

``` This looks IMO correct: ``` diff --git a/thirdparty/openssl/ssl/ssl_lib.c b/thirdparty/openssl/ssl/ssl_lib.c index 24be376..9e45af7 100644 --- a/thirdparty/openssl/ssl/ssl_lib.c +++ b/thirdparty/openssl/ssl/ssl_lib.c @@ -1052,6 +1052,14 @@ int SSL_write(SSL *s, const void *buf, int num) SSLerr(SSL_F_SSL_WRITE, SSL_R_PROTOCOL_IS_SHUTDOWN); return (-1); } + + printf("XXXX SSL_write\n-=-"); + for (int i = 0; i < num; i++) { + printf("%c", ((char *)buf)[i]); + } + printf("-=-\n"); + + return (s->method->ssl_write(s, buf, num)); } ``` prints out ``` XXXX SSL_write -=-GET /tests/godot/ HTTP/1.1 Host: www.capitanio.org:443 User-Agent: GodotEngine/3.0.alpha.custom_build (X11) Accept: */* -=- ``` **Link to minimal example project:** [network-test-gv3-02.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1070590/network-test-gv3-02.zip)

data.title: Issues with marquee selection in the 3d viewport
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Godot 3.0 Win10 and Linux Mint


**Issue description:**
Some node types cannot be marquee selected in the 3d viewport. This included MeshInstance and MeshInstance as a child of a Spatial node. Neither a single object or multiple objects of these types can be selected in this manner.

If a MeshInstance is made a child of a Position3d node it can be marquee selected in the viewport.

Of those nodes that cannot be marquee selected, they can all be selected with a single click in the viewport, except for an instanced scene with a Spatial node as the root.

An instanced scene containing meshes under a spatial node cannot be selected in any manner in the viewport. However an instanced scene with meshes under a Position3d node can be selected via marquee or single click.

**Included scene:**

![selection_test](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7741669/27070671-5a9f0560-505d-11e7-860f-4a1dfcf6ef89.jpeg)

This project contains most of the selection anomalies that I have come across.

[selection_test.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1070624/selection_test.tar.gz)

data.title: emission material will still contribute to giprobe when toggled off
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 3.0 Win10 and Linux Mint

**Issue description:**
When a material has an energy value over 1 (and a color other than black), but the enabled flag is off it will still contribute light to the giprobe for baking.

![emission_bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7741669/27068286-a0af8b8e-5052-11e7-9f3b-80e57f158c83.jpeg)


**Steps to reproduce:**

Setup an emissive material as per normal, then toggle off the emission enabled flag. The object with this material will still contribute to gi, but the emissive material will not display on the object.

**Further ideas:**

After discussing this with reduz, it could be a good idea to have a flag (under Emission) that could be toggled to replicate this behaviour intentionally.

If this was taken to the next logical level, it would be very useful to be able to specify how bright the visible emission was, as compared to its gi energy contribution. When turning up the emission energy to get enough light it often results in the visible part of the object clipping to full white and losing any other surface properties (emission color, reflections) of the object.

If it were possible to have the visible emission as a separate slider to the gi contribution ,it would enable a wider variety of glowing and emission effects. While this may not be physically correct, it is more art directable and can look more attractive. If you look at a glowing light bulb in real life, you can still see the form(and writing etc) on the bulb, but in cg this is usually just an clipped/ overbright white.

In this example image, I have baked the scene with the emission energy of the balls material all on 8. After baking I have dialed the energy value down to 8/6/4/2 respectively, which can potentially give a more desired look(particularly the 2nd image) without the visible emission clipping to white. The only problem with doing this, is that upon subsequent rebakes you would have to manually tweak each emissive material back to this value. Not sure if this even possible with PBR but it would be very useful? Could also work the other way around...ie a low gi energy value for baking and then overcranking the visible value for an intentional overbright/clipped look.

![energy_visible_idea](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7741669/27068927-c964cb2c-5055-11e7-9387-ae9cddc70c3b.jpeg)






**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Enable by default 2D motion fix on 2.x
data.body:
**Godot version: 2.1.3**

**Issue description:**
The project setting to fix move on KinematicBodie2Ds is off by default for compatibility but I think it should be enabled on new projects.

The option is on `Project Settings>Physics 2D>motion_fix_enabled`.

data.title: Improve and redesign mouse Input Event
data.body:
# Mouse input Event


@pixelpicosean recently and Myself a couple of month ago both put effort in making trackpad support better.
This issue should sum up the ideas to discuss them. There are a couple of discussions in pr's which talk about the same topic but I though a dedicated place would be nice.

## current implementation:
most mouse events are just "hacked" into the mouse button event. With custom mouse buttons like:
scrollUp /  ScrollDown / scrollLeft / scrollRight and recently Magnify. Precision input is than achieved by a float called `factor` which is set to the value how far the mouse was scrolled/magnified.

All this made sense When trackpads were simpler and mouses only used scroll wheels which had increments and fired events on each increment. So the wheel actually behaved like a button.

## Current Issues:
the issue with this implementation is that it is hard to figure out what event to use for scrolling and magnifying, Because mouse button does not seem to be the most obvious thing (if you don't know about it)
In addition to that it does not fit at all into the new introduced class based event system. Each event type should be another class. not the same class with different types.

# Proposal for redesign:

## 1. move different mouse events to classes
Events all of them Inherit From `InpuEventMouse` so you have access to position...
```cpp
InputEvnetMouseScroll
    Vector2 direction
InputEvnetMouseGesturePinch
    float zoom
InputEvnetMouseGestureRotate
    float angle
InputEvnetMouseGestureSwipe
    Vector2i direction
    float speed
InputEventMouseButton
    int button
    bool pressed
...
```

This system is much more straight forward to use:

## comparison:

### example for moving node with a trackpad scroll
old:
```cpp
if event is InputEventMouseButton:
    if event.buttonIndex == MOUSE_BUTTON_SCROLL_LEFT:
        node.position.x -= event.factor
    else If event.buttonIndex == MOUSE_BUTTON_SCROLL_RIGHT:
        node.position.x += event.factor
    if event.buttonIndex == MOUSE_BUTTON_SCROLL_UP:
        node.position.y -= event.factor
    else If event.buttonIndex == MOUSE_BUTTON_SCROLL_DOWN:
        node.position.y += event.factor
```

new:
```cpp
if event is InputMouseScroll:
    node.position += event.direction
```

### example for sizing node with a Pinch gesture
old:
```cpp
if event is InputEventMouseButton:
    if event.button_index == MOUSE_BUTTON_GESTURE_PINCH:
        node.size += event.factor
```
new:
```cpp
if event is InputEventMouseGesturePinch:
    node.size += event.zoom
```

## 2. Add device enum

in InputEventMouse:

```
enum Device{
    DEVICE_TRACKPAD
    DEVICE_MOUSE
    ... and maybe drawing table or touchscreen (although that is handled by compleatly different events)     or special apple mouse with touch ;)
}
InputEventMouse
    Device device
```

This allows to determine the input device and execute different actions for different devices.

### example
scroll up in 3d could be panning or orbiting when it is emitted by a touchpad and zoom when it is emitted by a mouse

scroll down in 2d: panning when using DEVICE_TRACKPAD and zoom DEVICE_MOUSE
 ```cpp
if event is InputEventMouseScroll:
    if event.device == DEVICE_MOUSE:
         viewport.zoom += event.direction.y
    else if event.device == DEVICE_TRACKPAD:
        vieport.scrollOffset += event.direction
```

## To Discuss

 - of course as always everything (it's godot community, ppl like feedback ;) ).
 - naming: InputEvnetMouseGesturePinch or InputEvnetMousePinch
     - is the Gesture keyword necessary?
 - Is a swipe gesture actually beneficial or should it just be implemented with scroll left/right and some threshold logic (I love using swiping to switch scripts so in general that would be a nice feature. although I think it might be better to implement it as an signal listener for controls. Since every swipe also needs setup when it triggers...)
 - naming of `direction, zoom, angle`. What would you type in when trying to get the scroll value of a class named `InputEventMouseScroll` ?

*the code I posed is more or less pseudocode. I don't event know if I used correct class and constant names... (pls don't judge)*

data.title: Possibility to control the camera directly from the preview mode
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 64 bits - Godot 3.0

**Priority**
Low

**Issue description:**
Currently when clicking on the camera preview button on the upper right corner of the viewport we can see through the camera lens.  It would be even better if the user has the possibility to control the camera directly from the preview mode (while seeing what the camera sees). It would help a lot for camera set ups and fine adjustements.
e.g: using keyboard arrows to move up/down/left/right and rotate. Or create a  mini virtual camera gizmo on  the bottom right corner.

data.title: Need more vertex attributes (for terrain shading)
data.body:
Shading a heightmap terrain as a module using texture arrays requires at least the following vertex attributes:

By usage + type:
- POSITION (Vector3)
- NORMAL (Vector3)
- BLEND_INDICES (Vector4)
- BLEND_WEIGHTS (Vector4) <-- also note the engine doesn't have Vector4

In order to be able to do this in the shader (assuming texarrays are supported):

```glsl
	c += texture2DArray(s, vec3(uv.xy, indices.x)) * weigths.x;
	c += texture2DArray(s, vec3(uv.xy, indices.y)) * weigths.y;
	c += texture2DArray(s, vec3(uv.xy, indices.z)) * weigths.z;
	c += texture2DArray(s, vec3(uv.xy, indices.w)) * weigths.w;
```

However the amount of attributes currently in engine are limited for this.
In theory I could use COLOR, UV and UV2 to have those 8 missing floats, but if COLOR needs to be used for something else then there is not enough attributes left (TANGENTS, BONES and WEIGHTS give only 2 floats and an int).

Given that GLES3 allows for any number of attributes (no longer hardcoded), is there a chance we can have more, or at best custom vertex attributes in 3.0?

Other data types works as expected. data.title: UWP: InputEvent: Renamed "pos" property to "position"
data.body: To comply with the changes from #9031.

data.title: UWP exported app does not work in release mode
data.body:
I'm having a hard time figuring out this problem, so I'll leave this issue open until I (or someone else) can solve it. This is valid for 2.1 and 2.2, so I assume it is the same for master.

The UWP app exported does not run when installed, it just crashes on opening. The only debug info I have is the EventViewer, which does not help at all:

`ActivateApplicationForContractByAppIdAsUserWithHost of the app Godot.Engine.Test_q1xfrwf3pzxew!App for the Windows.Launch contract failed with Access is denied..`

Trying to debug the installed app from Visual Studio (via Debug > Other Debug Targets > Debug Installed App Package) is not helpful because it runs fine there! So there's something fishy about how apps are launched that is a mystery (at least for me).

Summing up what I know:

1. The app runs fine if compiled with `target=debug` or `target=release_debug` build, but crashes on opening with `target=release`.
2. The `target=release` build runs fine from Visual Studio, even when debugging the installed app.
3. Compiling the release with `/SUBSYSTEM:CONSOLE` instead of `/SUBSYSTEM:WINDOWS` makes it work, but also opens the console window when launched.
4. This is not the case when running on the phone emulator. The release build opens fine there.

data.body:

Arch 64 bit - Godot 2.1.3 stable.offical form Steam
JDK: openjdk 8.u131-1 and Oracle JDK 8

Debug keystore created with following commands 
`keytool -keyalg RSA -genkeypair -alias androiddebugkey -keypass android -keystore debug.keystore -storepass android -dname "CN=Android Debug,O=Android,C=US" -validity 9999` 
and 
`keytool -keyalg RSA -genkeypair -alias androiddebugkey -keypass android -keystore debug.keystore -storepass android -dname "CN=Android Debug,O=Android,C=US" -validity 9999 -sigalg MD5withRSA -keyalg RSA`
